intro: Eumorphia sericea, commonly known as the silky eumorphia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy, slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbel-like clusters. The plant is native to parts of southern Africa, where it thrives in grassland and rocky habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a delicate, silvery appearance due to the dense covering of fine hairs. Eumorphia sericea is typically found in dry environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
